Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Keenfolks is a global Integrative A.I. Agency that connects Business, Marketing & Prop Technology to deliver efficiency and growth to Fortune 500 companies. We work with Merck Pharmaceutical, Coca-Cola, Johnson & Johnson, Reckitt, Danone, Nestle, Kellogg's, Royal Canine, Femsa & more brands in more than 40 markets worldwide.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Our vision is to become the leader in INTEGRATIVE A. I empower multinationals to grow efficiency and sales.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Our mission is to fuel GREATNESS to companies, individuals, and society through Human Centric A.I. Transformation.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

So, what do we do exactly?‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We create AI-first end-to-end global and local programs to help multinationals create new revenue business models, implement edge innovation, design experience, create tech strategy, lead business & digital transformation, implement Web 3 Strategy, accelerate sales and automation. You can learn more about our service on our website.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment and Fine-Tuning: Deploy and fine-tune open-source LLMs using platforms like Hugging Face. Ensure models are optimized for performance and scalability.
Data Preparation and Analysis: Prepare and preprocess data for training and fine-tuning LLMs. Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Experimentation and Innovation: Conduct experiments to test the performance of different LLM architectures. Stay updated with the latest research and advancements in the field of natural language processing (NLP).
Integration and Deployment: Integrate LLMs into existing applications and services. Deploy models on cloud platforms, particularly AWS SageMaker, to ensure robustness and scalability.
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams including engineering, product, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.
Documentation and Reporting: Document methodologies, processes, and findings. Create detailed reports and presentations for technical and non-technical audiences.



Required Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience in data science roles, with a focus on NLP and LLMs.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python.
Experience with NLP libraries and frameworks (e.g., Hugging Face, Transformers).
Hands-on experience with AWS SageMaker for model deployment.
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
Strong understanding of data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex data sets to derive actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications


Certifications: AWS Certified Machine Learning ‚Äì Specialty, or other relevant certifications.
Experience: Prior experience in deploying LLMs in production environments. Experience with other cloud platforms (e.g., Google Cloud, Azure) is a plus.



Perks:


Dynamic, young and international environment with +26 nationalities in our Barcelona office!
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Fun and creative work environment.
Work from home flexibility (2 days at the office)
Lunch, coffee and snacks at the office
Short Fridays
Regular team outings and social events.
An entrepreneurial environment that encourages continuous innovation
Company culture built on passion, trust and constructive freedom
Career development and continuous opportunities to grow üöÄ



YOUR ATTITUDE:

We believe in pushing our boundaries, we believe that innovation requires vulnerability and so, we take calculated risks. Here at Keenfolks, we're constantly in search of greatness and never settle for just being good. We recognise and reward those that consider themselves to be change-makers and experimental in their approach, therefore, we're keen to connect with innovators‚Ä¶someone that takes the learning in each experience, coupled with them having an entrepreneurial mindset.

DIVERSITY MATTERS:

Keenfolks is an equal employer. It is the policy of Keenfolks to give equal opportunities in career and development regardless of gender identity, gender reassignment, sexual identity, sexual orientation, marital status, race, color skin, ethnic origin, age, political view, religion, disability, pregnancy, maternity, paternity, life history, religion, neurodiversity, national origin, military service (veterans), persons with VIH and any other similar virus.

This policy is aslo aggaints to force and child labor.

We believe in true equality for all, and so, through our culture, corporate social responsibility, and day to day activities, we hope and strive to have a positive impact on today's society.

Nowadays our teams are fit to those with motor and some psychic disabilities, however, we‚Äôre also working to be able to receive sensory disabilities soon!

WANT TO KNOW MORE?

Follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram @the_keenfolks to learn more about our culture & values!

Title: Clinical Data Scientist
Place: Sant Feliu de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Mission

Based on best international practices, capture, integrate and store clinical trials information (data and documents) to allow on-going data analysis and results reporting to access efficiently to clinical data of our medicinal products and to allow a shorter decision making process.




Tasks and Responsibilities

Responsible for performing the necessary internal processes and overviewing CRO activities for adherence to the applicable data standards, quality and timelines, following Good Clinical Data Management Practices and applicable Clinical Trials Regulations, like FDA, EMA, ICH.
Review the protocol for adherence to Almirall Data Management processes and Data Standards.
Lead the review and approval electronic Case Report Form (eCRF), electronic Patient Reporting Outcomes (ePRO) and its corresponding completion guidelines.
Management of any data finding or/and processes during trial conduction that implies changes in the standards/processes in alignment with the responsible lead of coordinating these standards.
Set-up: Review annotated documents, Data Management Plan (coding, validation plan, SAE reconciliation between safety and clinical databases) vendor‚Äôs technical specifications (from DM perspective)
Conduct: Manage with the CRO in order to have data available for data visualization and analysis at the agreed milestones established at contract level. Assessment of the database structure and study documentation review, evaluation of the data quality in on-going basis. Coordination of Almirall data review activities and follow-up or finding resolution with CRO.
Closure: Management of the database lock processes, review related database lock documentation (including approval of coding and SAE reconciliation), evaluation of the database quality (minimum requirements) before database lock approval to warrantee Almirall requirements.
Provision to CROs of the necessary documentation to perform the outsourced activities according to Almirall standards processes and expectations.
Follow-up on target and metrics indicators for overseeing quality and deliverables of CRO Data Management activities.
Participation together with the Q&A department in the inspections derived from the clinical trial.
Provide technical advice on Data Management methodologies and processes to other departments or areas of R&D and the company who requires it.
Analysis and assessment of new standards, systems and processes. Collaboration in implementation and development of new technologies. Meeting with external assessors & regulatory authorities when required.
Participation in Data Management Associations, trainings and Congresses, national and international, related to Data Management and Clinical Development methodology and techniques, with the objective of warranting the continuous training and regular update of the required knowledge. Working with Partners in different projects.




Education

Bachelor degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Life and Health Science (Pharmacy, Veterinary, Medicine, Biology), IT or Degree with specific experience in the Job.




Experience

2+ years of experience as Clinical Data Scientist or Data Manager in the Pharma industry or a CRO.
Working knowledge of CDSIC (SDTM standards).
Clinical trials.
Project Management and planning experience.
Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken) across different levels within the organization.




Values and competencies

‚Ä¢ Care: we listen & empathize, we value diverse perspectives & backgrounds and we help each other succeed.

‚Ä¢ Courage: we challenge the status quo, we take full ownership and we learn from our success & failures

‚Ä¢ Innovation: we put the patient and customer at the center, we create novel solutions and we empower entrepreneurial mindsets.

‚Ä¢ Simplicity: we act decisively and avoid over-analysis, we understand why before we act and we are agile & keep things simple.

Show more

  • Review the protocol for adherence to Almirall Data Management processes and Data Standards.
  • Lead the review and approval electronic Case Report Form (eCRF), electronic Patient Reporting Outcomes (ePRO) and its corresponding completion guidelines.
  • Management of any data finding or/and processes during trial conduction that implies changes in the standards/processes in alignment with the responsible lead of coordinating these standards.
  • Set-up: Review annotated documents, Data Management Plan (coding, validation plan, SAE reconciliation between safety and clinical databases) vendor‚Äôs technical specifications (from DM perspective)
  • Conduct: Manage with the CRO in order to have data available for data visualization and analysis at the agreed milestones established at contract level. Assessment of the database structure and study documentation review, evaluation of the data quality in on-going basis. Coordination of Almirall data review activities and follow-up or finding resolution with CRO.
  • Closure: Management of the database lock processes, review related database lock documentation (including approval of coding and SAE reconciliation), evaluation of the database quality (minimum requirements) before database lock approval to warrantee Almirall requirements.
  • Provision to CROs of the necessary documentation to perform the outsourced activities according to Almirall standards processes and expectations.
  • Follow-up on target and metrics indicators for overseeing quality and deliverables of CRO Data Management activities.
  • Participation together with the Q&A department in the inspections derived from the clinical trial.
  • Provide technical advice on Data Management methodologies and processes to other departments or areas of R&D and the company who requires it.
  • Analysis and assessment of new standards, systems and processes. Collaboration in implementation and development of new technologies. Meeting with external assessors & regulatory authorities when required.
  • Participation in Data Management Associations, trainings and Congresses, national and international, related to Data Management and Clinical Development methodology and techniques, with the objective of warranting the continuous training and regular update of the required knowledge. Working with Partners in different projects.


Education

Bachelor degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Life and Health Science (Pharmacy, Veterinary, Medicine, Biology), IT or Degree with specific experience in the Job.


Experience

  • 2+ years of experience as Clinical Data Scientist or Data Manager in the Pharma industry or a CRO.
  • Working knowledge of CDSIC (SDTM standards).
  • Clinical trials.
  • Project Management and planning experience.
  • Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken) across different levels within the organization.


Values and competencies

‚Ä¢ Care: we listen & empathize, we value diverse perspectives & backgrounds and we help each other succeed.

‚Ä¢ Courage: we challenge the status quo, we take full ownership and we learn from our success & failures

‚Ä¢ Innovation: we put the patient and customer at the center, we create novel solutions and we empower entrepreneurial mindsets.

‚Ä¢ Simplicity: we act decisively and avoid over-analysis, we understand why before we act and we are agile & keep things simple.

Description:
Descripci√≥n del puesto: ¬øQu√© proyectos desarrollamos?

¬†

La misi√≥n de la direcci√≥n de Transformaci√≥n Digital de Auditor√≠a es liderar el proceso de cambio tecnol√≥gico, buscando mejorar la eficiencia, la innovaci√≥n y la experiencia de los auditores y auditados; adoptando nuevas herramientas y cambiando procesos para aprovechar al m√°ximo las capacidades digitales disponibles, con especial foco en el √°mbito de la anal√≠tica avanzada, automatizaci√≥n e inteligencia artificial.¬†Adem√°s, como parte propia de la funci√≥n se realizan revisiones de auditor√≠a que tienen por objetivo identificar y evaluar riesgos de tecnolog√≠as emergentes o de calidad del dato, principalmente.La posici√≥n de Data Scientist consiste en:

Identificar y definir nuevos casos de uso relacionados con anal√≠tica avanzada, tanto para uso interno como para dar soporte a otras direcciones de Auditor√≠a.

Requisitos m√≠nimos

M√≠nimo 5 a√±os de experiencia laboral, incluyendo roles de gesti√≥n y anal√≠tica, etc.

La experiencia en sector financiero y en √°reas o funciones de control se considerar√° un plus

Tecnolog√≠as requeridas¬†

Nivel medio/alto de SQL: consultas y ordenaci√≥n, funciones de agregaci√≥n, joins y subconsultas, modificaci√≥n de datos, indexaci√≥n y optimizaci√≥n, creaci√≥n de vistas y procedimientos, transacciones y modelado de datos. Conocimiento de PL/SQL y BigQuery se considerar√° un plus.
Nivel medio de Python (OOP, manejo de I/O, excepciones y capacidad de debugging). Conocimiento de R se considerar√° un plus.
Conocimientos de Git: Inicializaci√≥n de repositorios, comandos b√°sicos, branching y merging, resoluci√≥n de conflictos, tagging, revertir cambios, y buenas praxis en flujos de trabajo (main/test/dev).
Conocimiento de orquestaci√≥n deseables (Airflow, Composer, etc): definici√≥n de flujos de trabajo (DAG), planificaci√≥n y ejecuci√≥n, manejo de variables y par√°metros, monitoreo y registro, y manejo de errores.
Conocimientos de servicios cloud especialmente en GCP: contenedores y orquestaci√≥n, servicios serverless, automatizaci√≥n de infraestructura, monitorizaci√≥n y registro.

Requerimientos anal√≠ticos

An√°lisis exploratorio (EDA): estad√≠stica descriptiva, estudio de distribuciones y relaciones, visualizaci√≥n, etc.
Estad√≠stica y aprendizaje autom√°tico: probabilidad, inferencia, regresi√≥n, clasificaci√≥n, supervisados no supervisados, algoritmos de aprendizaje profundo etc.
Conocimiento de Frameworks m√°s comunes (scikit-learn, pandas, numpy, caret, tidyverse, etc).

Manejo y uso de notebooks.

Nivel medio/alto sobre optimizaci√≥n de modelos: estrategias y t√©cnicas de optimizaci√≥n y ajuste de hiperpar√°metros, selecci√≥n de modelos para best-fitting, etc.
Nociones sobre despliegue y monitorizaci√≥n de modelos: familiaridad con estrategias y herramientas para implementar modelos en entornos productivos, comprensi√≥n del stack necesario y de las buenas praxis.¬†
¬øQu√© ofrecemos?

¬†

Formar parte del Banco m√°s innovador en Europa Occidental 2021 seg√∫n los premios The Innovators de la revista estadounidense Global Finance.
Desarrollar una carrera profesional interna.

SIXENSE Satellite division is based in Barcelona and holds an international team of excellence with more than 20 years of experience processing Satellite images to measure deformation of buildings, infrastructure, and the ground surface. The Satellite team is involved in Industrial, Research and innovation projects worldwide.

We are looking for a Graduate in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, or other relevant discipline with a strong AI/ML background for our data analytics team. Knowledge of geospatial data libraries and GIS techniques will be positively valued.

Your primary focus will be in contributing to the development of data products from Earth Observation and/or in-situ sensors, including algorithm development and implementation. In particular, you will be working with big datasets of ground deformation timeseries with the objective to build added value solutions with data science techniques.

You will also be involved in institutional projects, on behalf of space agencies, development banks, etc.

Your Missions With Us


Research, design and/or implementation of algorithms with focus on spatio-temporal data analysis tasks (ground motion timeseries data).
Strategy development for the field of machine learning and data analysis with focus on Sixense applications (trend analysis, outlier detection, prediction, change detection‚Ä¶).
Promotion of collaborative research with interdisciplinary team.

Understanding of practical machine-learning techniques
Proactive nature and great attention to detail

Interest in Earth Observation

Title: Junior Cloud Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
We‚Äôre TD SYNNEX, a leading IT distributor and solutions aggregator for the IT ecosystem.

We‚Äôre 23,000 of the IT industry‚Äôs best and brightest, who share an unwavering passion for bringing compelling technology products, services and solutions to the world. We‚Äôre an innovative partner that helps our customers maximize the value of IT investments, demonstrate business outcomes and unlock growth opportunities.

At our core, we‚Äôre a company that cares. We care about our partners, our co-workers, our investors and the world around us. And we‚Äôre committed to being a diverse, inclusive employer of choice and a good corporate citizen.

Job Purpose:

TD SYNNEX‚Äôs strategy is to provide best in class services to its partners ‚Äì world leaders in technologies. A crucial building block of TD SYNNEX‚Äôs services is a comprehensive Data insights of the market trends and opportunities. TD SYNNEX has built a strong data analytics capability, focused on creating predictive insights, automation of the business processes and personalization of the partner interactions.

TD SYNNEX continues building up its highly successful Data Practice and looking for a passionate and talented Junior Data Scientist to join our European excellence team.

In this role, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to apply data governance and analytics to real-world business situations across various scenarios in the technology distribution industry. As the field of advanced analytics evolves rapidly, the Junior Data Scientist is responsible for staying current on emerging business applications, tools, and approaches, working collaboratively with the Analytics Leadership to enhance offerings that provide a competitive advantage to TD SYNNEX.

Responsibilities:


Utilize the latest data technologies, such as Snowflake SQL, Python/R, Tableau, Power BI, AWS Services, Microsoft Azure, etc.
Work with a large number and size of data sources, engaging in variable analytics use cases (handling truly BIG DATA).
Focus on real use cases, actively participating in end-to-end business solutions, including solution design and presentation of results, with a quick turnaround time for implementations.
Adopt an agile and experimental approach, enabling new implementations within days rather than months.
Collaborate with Cloud Vendor Business within TD SYNNEX departments and other BI Teams across the organization.
Integrate third-party APIs and services into our software ecosystem.


Qualifications, Skills and Experience:


Some working experience in Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Data Science is desired.
Fluency in English is required.
Relevant SQL skills.
Hands-on programming/scripting experience in Python or R, familiarity with Power BI and Power platforms.
Possess foundational data expertise with the ability to efficiently advise teams on uncovering critical insights for clients.
Demonstrate autonomy, passion for analytics, and problem-solving skills, contributing to the development of new Analytics service offerings.
Effective collaborator with a strong presence, capable of operating within a matrix organization.
Comfortable working with modern development tools, with the ability to synthesize complex data and translate machine learning techniques into business implications.
Confident in statistical and machine learning skills.
Strong team player with excellent communication skills and a proactive, self-motivated attitude.


What's in it for you?


A Team like no other! Yes, it‚Äôs the first one we list for a reason: We are a dynamic, proactive and multi-national team consisting of uniquely creative individuals from all walks of life. Nothing more important than the people you surround yourself with, and we consider our team as the greatest benefit of all.
As International as it gets! We are represented in 100+ countries and multicultural exchanges are a daily routine.
Sheer limitless career development: Opportunities across job functions, departments and geographical locations. Various trainings, courses and certifications will enable you to enrich your technical expertise.
Empowerment! The possibility to co-develop business procedures and to be part of the success of our global organisation.
Supportive working climate. Managers become mentors and colleagues become friends, at the office as well as after working hours. You will have regular touchpoints with your direct superior in which you can talk about anything you want and all our experts.
Various well-being initiatives. We care about YOU, so allow us to ensure that you are doing well. Additionally, you are encouraged to enjoy our cozy outdoor Chill-Out area whenever the sun is shining, or retreat from your screen for some Fussball-Kicker or Arcade Action.
Medical security. It has become crucial, so we provide health and dental insurance, besides medical experts (General Practitioner) and Physiotherapy services at the office (depends on location).
Social Responsibility. We care immensely about you, and so we also care about the community around us. Thus, Tech Data is actively involved in numerous initiatives worldwide to support projects that make this world a better place.
Hybrid working model, because it simply offers the best of both worlds.
Monetary Benefits? How about a plethora of choices when it comes to discounts - Travel, clothing, toys, sport,‚Ä¶ and much more. Our partnerships enable you to save on almost everything, and obviously: our IT discounts on hardware/software for employees are a real steal.
Flexible compensation. Competitive salary is nice, and we offer it, but we think it is has become necessary for you to diversify and increase your net salary.


Interested to learn more? We look forward to hearing from you soon!

What‚Äôs In It For You?


Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It‚Äôs not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.

At TD SYNNEX, we‚Äôre proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you‚Äôre excited about working for our company and believe you‚Äôre a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we‚Äôre looking for!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Company Overview

Founded in 1993, Baxter Planning has 30+ years of industry expertise setting the standard for SaaS in the service supply chain planning space. With a strong and growing customer base, we are developing new products and solutions as well as finding new ways to extend and enhance our established products building on our success in the market. We combine the agility and innovation of a start-up with the stability of an established, profitable, global company.

Location

Baxter Planning is headquartered in Austin, Texas with offices in Spain and India. Though this role will mostly be remote, the position will be located out of our rapidly growing Barcelona office.

Joining Baxter Planning you will find that we strongly value our team members and culture as it is reflected in our generous benefits, exciting and supportive work environment, and excellent work-life balance.

Responsibilities:


Develop end to end ML solutions using python
Create and perform experiments to evaluate innovative solutions using AI and ML
Create and maintain e2e ML pipelines
Work with costumers and product teams to create innovative solutions using ML models
Deploy and maintain ML solution in cloud environments (AWS)


Qualifications and skills needed:


Technical degree: engineering, computer science, physics, Maths, quantitative economics, etc
5+ Years of experience in data science
Advance python programming
Version control (git)
Advanced SQL
Proficiency in development ML models
Solid experience using data/ml libraries like Pandas, SKlearn, Darts, TensorFlow, XGBoost, etc


Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Keenfolks is a global Integrative A.I. Agency that connects Business, Marketing & Prop Technology to deliver efficiency and growth to Fortune 500 companies. We work with Merck Pharmaceutical, Coca-Cola, Johnson & Johnson, Reckitt, Danone, Nestle, Kellogg's, Royal Canine, Femsa & more brands in more than 40 markets worldwide.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Our vision is to become the leader in INTEGRATIVE A. I empower multinationals to grow efficiency and sales.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Our mission is to fuel GREATNESS to companies, individuals, and society through Human Centric A.I. Transformation.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

So, what do we do exactly?‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We create AI-first end-to-end global and local programs to help multinationals create new revenue business models, implement edge innovation, design experience, create tech strategy, lead business & digital transformation, implement Web 3 Strategy, accelerate sales and automation. You can learn more about our service on our website.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment and Fine-Tuning: Deploy and fine-tune open-source LLMs using platforms like Hugging Face. Ensure models are optimized for performance and scalability.
Data Preparation and Analysis: Prepare and preprocess data for training and fine-tuning LLMs. Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends.
Experimentation and Innovation: Conduct experiments to test the performance of different LLM architectures. Stay updated with the latest research and advancements in the field of natural language processing (NLP).
Integration and Deployment: Integrate LLMs into existing applications and services. Deploy models on cloud platforms, particularly AWS SageMaker, to ensure robustness and scalability.
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with cross-functional teams including engineering, product, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.
Documentation and Reporting: Document methodologies, processes, and findings. Create detailed reports and presentations for technical and non-technical audiences.



Required Qualifications


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience in data science roles, with a focus on NLP and LLMs.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python.
Experience with NLP libraries and frameworks (e.g., Hugging Face, Transformers).
Hands-on experience with AWS SageMaker for model deployment.
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
Strong understanding of data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex data sets to derive actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications


Certifications: AWS Certified Machine Learning ‚Äì Specialty, or other relevant certifications.
Experience: Prior experience in deploying LLMs in production environments. Experience with other cloud platforms (e.g., Google Cloud, Azure) is a plus.



Perks:


Dynamic, young and international environment with +26 nationalities in our Barcelona office!
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Fun and creative work environment.
Work from home flexibility (2 days at the office)
Lunch, coffee and snacks at the office
Short Fridays
Regular team outings and social events.
An entrepreneurial environment that encourages continuous innovation
Company culture built on passion, trust and constructive freedom
Career development and continuous opportunities to grow üöÄ



YOUR ATTITUDE:

We believe in pushing our boundaries, we believe that innovation requires vulnerability and so, we take calculated risks. Here at Keenfolks, we're constantly in search of greatness and never settle for just being good. We recognise and reward those that consider themselves to be change-makers and experimental in their approach, therefore, we're keen to connect with innovators‚Ä¶someone that takes the learning in each experience, coupled with them having an entrepreneurial mindset.

DIVERSITY MATTERS:

Keenfolks is an equal employer. It is the policy of Keenfolks to give equal opportunities in career and development regardless of gender identity, gender reassignment, sexual identity, sexual orientation, marital status, race, color skin, ethnic origin, age, political view, religion, disability, pregnancy, maternity, paternity, life history, religion, neurodiversity, national origin, military service (veterans), persons with VIH and any other similar virus.

This policy is aslo aggaints to force and child labor.

We believe in true equality for all, and so, through our culture, corporate social responsibility, and day to day activities, we hope and strive to have a positive impact on today's society.

Nowadays our teams are fit to those with motor and some psychic disabilities, however, we‚Äôre also working to be able to receive sensory disabilities soon!

WANT TO KNOW MORE?

Follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram @the_keenfolks to learn more about our culture & values!

We believe in true equality for all, and so, through our culture, corporate social responsibility, and day to day activities, we hope and strive to have a positive impact on today's society.

Nowadays our teams are fit to those with motor and some psychic disabilities, however, we‚Äôre also working to be able to receive sensory disabilities soon!

WANT TO KNOW MORE?

Follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram @the_keenfolks to learn more about our culture & values!

Title: Clinical Data Scientist
Place: Sant Feliu de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Mission

Based on best international practices, capture, integrate and store clinical trials information (data and documents) to allow on-going data analysis and results reporting to access efficiently to clinical data of our medicinal products and to allow a shorter decision making process.




Tasks and Responsibilities

Responsible for performing the necessary internal processes and overviewing CRO activities for adherence to the applicable data standards, quality and timelines, following Good Clinical Data Management Practices and applicable Clinical Trials Regulations, like FDA, EMA, ICH.
Review the protocol for adherence to Almirall Data Management processes and Data Standards.
Lead the review and approval electronic Case Report Form (eCRF), electronic Patient Reporting Outcomes (ePRO) and its corresponding completion guidelines.
Management of any data finding or/and processes during trial conduction that implies changes in the standards/processes in alignment with the responsible lead of coordinating these standards.
Set-up: Review annotated documents, Data Management Plan (coding, validation plan, SAE reconciliation between safety and clinical databases) vendor‚Äôs technical specifications (from DM perspective)
Conduct: Manage with the CRO in order to have data available for data visualization and analysis at the agreed milestones established at contract level. Assessment of the database structure and study documentation review, evaluation of the data quality in on-going basis. Coordination of Almirall data review activities and follow-up or finding resolution with CRO.
Closure: Management of the database lock processes, review related database lock documentation (including approval of coding and SAE reconciliation), evaluation of the database quality (minimum requirements) before database lock approval to warrantee Almirall requirements.
Provision to CROs of the necessary documentation to perform the outsourced activities according to Almirall standards processes and expectations.
Follow-up on target and metrics indicators for overseeing quality and deliverables of CRO Data Management activities.
Participation together with the Q&A department in the inspections derived from the clinical trial.
Provide technical advice on Data Management methodologies and processes to other departments or areas of R&D and the company who requires it.
Analysis and assessment of new standards, systems and processes. Collaboration in implementation and development of new technologies. Meeting with external assessors & regulatory authorities when required.
Participation in Data Management Associations, trainings and Congresses, national and international, related to Data Management and Clinical Development methodology and techniques, with the objective of warranting the continuous training and regular update of the required knowledge. Working with Partners in different projects.




Education

Bachelor degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Life and Health Science (Pharmacy, Veterinary, Medicine, Biology), IT or Degree with specific experience in the Job.




Experience

2+ years of experience as Clinical Data Scientist or Data Manager in the Pharma industry or a CRO.
Working knowledge of CDSIC (SDTM standards).
Clinical trials.
Project Management and planning experience.
Excellent English communication skills (written and spoken) across different levels within the organization.




Values and competencies

‚Ä¢ Care: we listen & empathize, we value diverse perspectives & backgrounds and we help each other succeed.

‚Ä¢ Courage: we challenge the status quo, we take full ownership and we learn from our success & failures

‚Ä¢ Innovation: we put the patient and customer at the center, we create novel solutions and we empower entrepreneurial mindsets.

‚Ä¢ Simplicity: we act decisively and avoid over-analysis, we understand why before we act and we are agile & keep things simple.

Title: BECARIO/A DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasi√≥n por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en m√°s de 115 pa√≠ses y nuestra presencia online se extiende a m√°s de 110 pa√≠ses. Nuestro equipo est√° formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

BECARIO/A DATA SCIENTIST

¬øC√ìMO SER√Å TU D√çA A D√çA EN MANGO?

Formar√°s parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones m√°s desafiantes dentro de la industria del fashion retail.

El equipo de Advanced Analytics de Mango est√° formado por Data Scientists, Big Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Deep Learning Researchers y Software Engineers que trabajan juntos en squads multidisciplinares para desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico de vanguardia aprovechando la √∫ltima tecnolog√≠a en plataformas de Big Data y computaci√≥n distribuida.

Cada uno de los squads de Advanced Analytics tiene como objetivo desarrollar y evolucionar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico para hacer frente a algunos de los principales retos t√©cnicos y empresariales de Mango.

¬øQU√â HACE UN DATA SCIENTIST EN MANGO?

Como Becario de Data Scientist especializado en NLP y LLM formar√°s parte del equipo que trabaja en la investigaci√≥n, definici√≥n, experimentaci√≥n, prototipado y puesta en producci√≥n de soluciones innovadoras basadas en algoritmos generativos de √∫ltima generaci√≥n.


Implementar√°s el prototipo de soluciones con algoritmos de Deep Learning para evaluar la viabilidad t√©cnica y la calidad de los resultados.
Trabajar√°s con modelos de Deep Learning complejos como los Large Language Models (LLM) para abordar m√∫ltiples casos de uso, implementando y refinando los prompts, empleando t√©cnicas de Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAGs) y evaluando la calidad de los resultados.
Participar√°s en pruebas de concepto para realizar el entrenamiento o fine tuning de estos modelos de acuerdo con las necesidades de cada caso de uso.
Trabajar√°s con una gran variedad de datos (estructurados y no estructurados), definiendo las fuentes de datos relevantes y preparando el set de datos necesario para entrenar los modelos de Deep Learning.
Estar√°s conectado a los √∫ltimos desarrollos en Deep Learning y podr√°s experimentar con t√©cnicas avanzadas de LLMs.



¬øQU√â ESPERAMOS DE TI?


Que est√©s estudiando un Ingenier√≠a Inform√°tica, Matem√°ticas o Estad√≠stica o Ciencia de Datos con buenos resultados acad√©micos.
Tengas capacidad para programar (o facilidad de aprendizaje) en Python, R o Scala.
Que tengas inter√©s en emplear modelos avanzados de Inteligencia Artificial.



¬øQU√â NOS HACE ESPECIALES?


Formar√°s parte de una empresa internacional en plena transformaci√≥n tecnol√≥gica, como parte del equipo de Data & Advanced Analytics de Mango.
6 meses de pr√°cticas (remuneradas).
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vall√®s para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.

We like you!

Title: AI/ML Software Developer
Description:
About Marvell

Marvell‚Äôs semiconductor solutions are the essential building blocks of the data infrastructure that connects our world. Across enterprise, cloud and AI, automotive, and carrier architectures, our innovative technology is enabling new possibilities.

At Marvell, you can affect the arc of individual lives, lift the trajectory of entire industries, and fuel the transformative potential of tomorrow. For those looking to make their mark on purposeful and enduring innovation, above and beyond fleeting trends, Marvell is a place to thrive, learn, and lead.

Your Team, Your Impact

The Central Engineering CAD organization at Marvell is a critical cog in the wheel of innovation. Without this team, Marvell would be unable to execute its vision of delivering cutting-edge technology to the world. Our team is responsible for developing design flows that are used by hundreds of engineers. These flows are instrumental in working with top-notch technologies like 5nm and 3nm, which are at the forefront of the semiconductor industry.

Every day, we work on supporting all business units within Marvell, providing them with the tools and processes they need to create their products. This gives our team members the unique opportunity to work on a variety of projects and teams, broadening their experience and knowledge.

Choosing to work with our team over another at a different company offers several advantages. Not only do you get to work on industry-leading technologies, but you also become part of a team that is at the heart of Marvell‚Äôs operations. Our work directly impacts the success of the company and, by extension, the advancement of technology in the world.

What You Can Expect


Design, develop, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code for command line tools.
Apply your knowledge of algorithms and machine learning to solve complex problems and implement solutions.
Work with databases to store, retrieve, and manipulate data for complex, high-volume software applications.
Utilize LLMs and Bedrock or similar APIs in the development process.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.


What We're Looking For


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Strong understanding of algorithms and machine learning.
Experience with Python and developing command line tools.
Knowledge of databases and SQL.
Familiarity with ASIC design is a plus.
Experience with LLMs and Bedrock or similar APIs.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Knowledge and Skills


Before starting in this role, the candidate must have a strong understanding of algorithms, machine learning, and databases. They should be proficient in Python and have experience developing command line tools. Familiarity with LLMs ( Large Language Models) and Bedrock or similar APIs is highly desirable. Knowledge of ASIC design is a plus, but not required.


Experience


The candidate should have worked on projects involving Python development, particularly creating command line tools. Experience with machine learning algorithms and working with databases is essential. If they have used LLMs and Bedrock or similar APIs in their previous projects, it would be a significant advantage.


Autonomy


While mentorship and guidance will be available, the candidate should be capable of working independently. They should be able to take ownership of their tasks, troubleshoot issues, and find solutions.


Aptitude


The candidate should be proficient in Python and familiar with its associated libraries and frameworks. They should have a good understanding of machine learning algorithms and be comfortable working with databases. Knowledge of LLMs and Bedrock or similar APIs would be beneficial.


Communication


The candidate should be able to effectively communicate their ideas to their team members and supervisors. They may not always be in the room when decisions are made, but they should be comfortable presenting their work and participating in discussions.

Additional Compensation And Benefit Elements

With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an environment of shared collaboration, transparency, and inclusivity. We‚Äôre dedicated to giving our people the tools and resources they need to succeed in doing work that matters, and to grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it‚Äôs like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

What We're Looking For

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Strong understanding of algorithms and machine learning.
  • Experience with Python and developing command line tools.
  • Knowledge of databases and SQL.
  • Familiarity with ASIC design is a plus.
  • Experience with LLMs and Bedrock or similar APIs.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills.
  • Knowledge and Skills

Before starting in this role, the candidate must have a strong understanding of algorithms, machine learning, and databases. They should be proficient in Python and have experience developing command line tools. Familiarity with LLMs ( Large Language Models) and Bedrock or similar APIs is highly desirable. Knowledge of ASIC design is a plus, but not required.

  • Experience

The candidate should have worked on projects involving Python development, particularly creating command line tools. Experience with machine learning algorithms and working with databases is essential. If they have used LLMs and Bedrock or similar APIs in their previous projects, it would be a significant advantage.

  • Autonomy

While mentorship and guidance will be available, the candidate should be capable of working independently. They should be able to take ownership of their tasks, troubleshoot issues, and find solutions.

  • Aptitude

The candidate should be proficient in Python and familiar with its associated libraries and frameworks. They should have a good understanding of machine learning algorithms and be comfortable working with databases. Knowledge of LLMs and Bedrock or similar APIs would be beneficial.

  • Communication

The candidate should be able to effectively communicate their ideas to their team members and supervisors. They may not always be in the room when decisions are made, but they should be comfortable presenting their work and participating in discussions.

Additional Compensation And Benefit Elements

With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an environment of shared collaboration, transparency, and inclusivity. We‚Äôre dedicated to giving our people the tools and resources they need to succeed in doing work that matters, and to grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it‚Äôs like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Building with the latest tools, our Machine Learning teams launch for Silicon Valley startups and Life Science giants alike.

Join Loka to work remotely, ship projects you're proud of and enjoy every other Friday off.

The Role


Understand business objectives and develop models that help achieve them, plus metrics to track their progress.
Design and implement complex ML systems using classical ML, DL and Foundation Models and following best practices.
Lead client communications by gathering requirements, managing expectations and communicating deliverables.
Wrangle, explore and visualize data with a careful eye for issues that require data cleaning as well as differences in data distribution that may affect performance after deployment.
Analyze model errors; design strategies to overcome them.
Deploy, maintain and upgrade ML models and pipelines.
Follow Loka's career track for growth by demonstrating technical excellence, innovation, autonomy, ownership, communication and teamwork.


The Benefits


Every other Friday off (26 extra days off a year!)
LokaLabs incubator
Explore and Relocation programs (three months work abroad or full international relo)
Remote and flexible
Paid sick days and local holidays
Fitness subscription


The Required Hard Skills


4+ years of ML engineering experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related
Proficient in English
Experience with Python, ML libraries and AI/ML frameworks (PyTorch, HuggingFace, TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-learn, Spark etc.)
Strong understanding of statistical, ML and deep learning algorithms (candidates with NLP experience preferred)
Experience building GenAI solutions including prompt engineering (e.g: Langchain), fine-tuning and serving LLMs, search and embeddings, etc.
Experience with MLOps, preferably in AWS (e.g: Sagemaker), as well as standards tools (e.g. MLFlow)
Experience visualizing and manipulating big datasets
Client-facing experience
Clean criminal record


The Required Soft Skills


Curiosity‚ÄîAmbition to learn and grow into different industries with a modern tech stack
Autonomy and positivity‚ÄîWe're a fully remote, globally distributed team
Teamwork‚ÄîEnjoy a collaborative approach
Adaptability‚ÄîOperate with a startup mindset and move at a startup pace


Please submit your CV in English.

Title: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to engage our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity.

This could be your opportunity to lead a project of international scope and meet the challenges of digital transformation with an experienced and talented team.

At the same time, you are guaranteed to balance your work and family life, with premium benefits, stability and personal recognition.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to perform duties as a Data Scientist and integrate an Intelligent Customer Service while building a software solution to transform user experience on an omnichannel context and focusing on self service channel. This project aims to leverage and transform institutions' support service by introducing Artifical Intelligence cross channels.

Required Qualifications

üí° WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


+2 years of professional experience in similar areas;
MSc degree or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related field;
Demonstrated solid mathematical foundations and statistical consultancy, business sense, being able to quickly understand the use cases we are working on;
Proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning libraries such as PyTorch, scikit-learn, spaCy, NLTK, Hugging Face Transformers, etc;
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and techniques, including deep learning, natural language processing;
Experience with data pre-processing, feature engineering, and model evaluation;
Familiarity with data engineering, modelling and business analysis;
Good comunication skills.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience with Information Retrieval and LLMs;
Knowledge in Sentence Transformers, FastAPI;
Knowledge in technologies such as Opensearch;
Knowledge of cloud tools such as Azure, AWS, Google Cloud.


‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Opportunity to lead major projects

By leading projects for an international Axians customer, you can make your mark in the IT world.

Recognition as a professional and as a person

For Axians, the professionals who lead customer projects have a name and a face and are therefore recognized by the company.

Work Life Balance And Premium Benefits

Axians values the family life of its employees by giving 5 days beyond those legally provided after the birth of children. Later, they can attend technology courses with resource to scholarships.

Possibility To Become a Shareholder In The Company

In addition to career progression, you can be a shareholder in the VINCI Energies Group, which owns Axians.

Stability and job security

Axians has 14,000 employees and revenues of around ‚Ç¨3.3 billion. By leading major projects, you will join a solid and secure entity.

Fair Compensation

You will have access to basic salary + benefits and can also benefit from performance bonuses, health insurance and free psychologist consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is right for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with subject ‚ÄúDATASCIENCE_ML/TA/SR".

Learn more about Axians

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) is home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP offers rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe‚Äôs most attractive cities. The ACCP has been ranked as the #1 company in Best Workplaces (https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/) ranking in Portugal for companies between 201-500 employees, by the Great Place to Work Institute.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo ‚Äì Sete Rios, Av. Jos√© Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you‚Äôre part of something bigger, it‚Äôs because you are. At Amgen our shared mission‚Äîto serve patients‚Äîdrives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world‚Äôs leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together‚Äîresearching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It‚Äôs time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Machine Learning Engineer

LIVE

What You Will Do

Are you passionate about using machine learning to shape the future of healthcare? We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic team! The Decision Sciences team at Amgen plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving commercial success.

In this role, you will work closely with data scientists to develop and deploy cutting-edge machine learning algorithms by creating scalable frameworks, state-of-the-art tools, and efficient code. You will assist in the design and architecture of machine learning systems, collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate these solutions into production environments. Your focus will be on ensuring timely delivery and learning new toolsets and coding packages to stay current in the field.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play an active role in the tactical execution of machine learning projects, from ideation and prototyping to deployment and maintenance. You'll stay updated with technological advancements, ensuring our approaches are both innovative and effective. Your technical skills will be crucial in optimizing code for efficiency and scalability, and your ability to communicate complex concepts will help bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders. With a strong understanding of healthcare data, you will help ensure our solutions are impactful and fit for purpose. Join us in delivering high-impact machine learning projects and be a part of a team that's making a real difference in the world!

Other responsibilities will include:


Execute machine learning models and code, with a keen eye for quality outputs and consistency data.
Work along the entire lifecycle of cD&A machine learning projects, from ideation and prototyping to deployment and maintenance, ensuring timely and successful delivery of high-impact solutions
Assist data scientists in developing and implementing advanced machine learning algorithms by providing robust frameworks, tools, and infrastructure support.
Contribute to the design and architecture of machine learning systems and pipelines, ensuring scalability, robustness, and efficient data processing.
Optimize code for efficiency and scalability, ensuring modularity and maintainability in machine learning projects.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and product managers, to integrate machine learning solutions into production environments.
Conduct thorough research and stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and related technologies to inform and drive innovation within the team.
Assist in data acquisition and preprocessing strategies, working with data engineers to ensure high-quality data for model training and evaluation.
Communicate complex technical concepts and results to non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clear understanding and alignment with business objectives.


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


Master‚Äôs degree
OR
Bachelor‚Äôs degree and 2 years of machine learning experience.
University Degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.


Preferred Requirements:


Deep expertise in Python: Extensive experience in writing efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code for machine learning applications.
Proficiency in PySpark: Strong skills in using PySpark for large-scale data processing and analysis, with the ability to optimize for performance, scalability, and efficiency.
Familiarity with the Machine Learning Lifecycle: In-depth understanding of the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, from data acquisition and preprocessing to model deployment and monitoring.
Experience with Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with major cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, including their machine learning and data services.
Knowledge of Version Control Software: Proficiency with version control systems like Git, ensuring collaborative and streamlined development workflows.
Strong Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to tackle complex technical challenges and contribute to innovative solutions.
Attention to detail: Keen eye for detail in coding, model evaluation, and data analysis, ensuring the highest quality and accuracy in all deliverables.
Excellent Communication Skills: Capacity to convey technical concepts to a diverse audience, including non-technical stakeholders.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Distributed Cloud | Google Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

At Devoteam, we believe that technology with strong human values can actively drive change for the better. Discover how Tech for People unlocks the future, creating a positive impact on the people and the world around us. We are a global leading player in Digital Transformation for leading organisations across EMEA, with a revenue of ‚Ç¨652M. We believe in transforming technology to create value for our clients, partners and employees in a world where technology is developed for people. We are proud of the culture we have built together. We are proud of our people at the service of technology. We are proud of our diverse environment. Because we are¬†#TechforPeople. Join our multidisciplinary team of Cloud experts, Designers, Business consultants, Security experts, Engineers, Developers and other extraordinary talents, spread across more than 18 EMEA countries. Become one of our +8.000 tech and business leaders on cloud, data and cyber security. Let‚Äôs fuse creativity with technology together and build innovative solutions that actively change things for the better.


Job Description

We're seeking an experienced Data Scientist with a proven track record in advanced analytics, particularly customer lifecycle analysis and clustering techniques. You will leverage your expertise to drive data-driven decision-making, optimise customer journeys, and uncover valuable insights that directly impact business growth. As a key member of our AI team, you'll collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to develop and deploy innovative AI solutions.

Responsibilities:


Customer Lifecycle Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis of customer behaviour throughout their lifecycle, identifying key touchpoints and opportunities for engagement.


Clustering & Segmentation: Develop and implement sophisticated clustering models to segment customers based on various attributes and behaviours.


Predictive Modelling: Build predictive models to forecast customer churn, lifetime value, and other critical metrics.


AI Product Development: Collaborate on the design and implementation of AI-powered products and features that enhance the customer experience and drive business value.


Communication: Clearly communicate findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, using data visualisation and storytelling techniques.



Qualifications


Education: Graduate degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, etc.). Applicants with a different background who have a proven track record within Data & AI will also be considered.

Experience:


4+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Scientist, Data Engineer or Data Analyst, with a strong focus on customer analytics.


Proven ability to apply advanced analytics techniques (e.g., clustering, segmentation, predictive modelling) to real-world problems.


Previous contact with data manipulation, ETL processes, and data warehouse design is a plus.


Technical Skills:


Proficient in Python, with experience using data science libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, etc.).


Proficient with SQL.


Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus.


Knowledge of AI product development and deployment is a significant advantage.


Soft Skills:


Proficiency in English (mandatory).


Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.


Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.



Additional Information

The Devoteam Group works for equal opportunities, promoting its employees based on merit and actively fights against all forms of discrimination. We are convinced that diversity contributes to the creativity, dynamism and excellence of our organization. All of our vacancies are open to people with disabilities.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Lisbon)
Description:
Hi there!

We are Capgemini Engineering. A brand part of the Capgemini Group.

We have the mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, diversity, inclusion, a purpose of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can learn more about Capgemini Engineering here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MZ0Z6PjdnQo.

You can help us to achieve our mission!

Now, we are part of Capgemini Group and we have more than 300,000 team members in nearly 50 countries, and we work with sectors such as aeronautics, automotive, communications, energy, life sciences, software & internet, space & defense and consumer products.

Your Mission

Capgemini Engineering is constantly growing and attentive to market opportunities and in search of the best professionals to join its team. We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our team, on a hybrid format, with the possibility of participating in many interesting and cutting-edge projects through the whole life-cycle.

Your Role

A Senior Data Scientist exhibits expert-level understanding and execution of data science projects with a strategic impact on the organization. Responsibilities include:


Leadership and mentorship to teams of data scientists and analysts, guiding them to success on intricate data science initiatives.
Defining the strategic direction for data science projects, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
Conducting advanced analysis of complex datasets to derive profound insights, forecast trends, and pinpoint opportunities for improvement.
Designing, implementing, and evaluating advanced statistical models and machine learning algorithms to address high-impact business challenges.
Lead the integration of big data technologies and advanced analytics solutions into business processes, driving innovation in methodologies and practices.
Establishing best practices for data management, quality, and governance to ensure the integrity and reliability of data science outputs.
Effectively communicating complex analytical concepts and the value of data science initiatives to stakeholders at all levels, including executive leadership.
Advocating for a culture of data-driven decision-making and continuous learning within the organization.


Your Profile


7 or more years of experience in data science and analytics, with a proven track record of leading successful data science projects.
Proficiency of programming languages, including Python and SQL, along with advanced libraries and frameworks like TensorFlow or Pytorch.
Possess a deep understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, predictive modeling, and advanced algorithmic problem-solving.
Showcase extensive experience in data visualization and interpretation, translating complex results into actionable insights.
Exhibit leadership experience with the ability to inspire, guide, and mentor team members to achieve exceptional results.
Possess technical domain knowledge in cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) or big data technologies (Spark).
Have exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with fluency in English and the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.


What we Offer

Our Famous Atmosphere


There‚Äôs always someone happy to start the day with a cup of coffee with you ‚Äì even virtually!
We are a big company with a unique atmosphere ‚Äì we make friendships, share important moments, and‚Ä¶ simply like each other!


A Lot Of Benefits


Referral bonuses for recommending your friends to Capgemini Engineering.
Continuous training on Next*
Offices in a great location
Participation in international projects
Integration in a multinational company
Career Evolution


Location:


Lisbon full-time and hybrid


We inform you that our recruitment process is 100% remote

Apply Now!


Show more

  • Building data systems and pipelines;

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Company Description

Renesas is one of the top global semiconductor companies in the world. We strive to develop a safer, healthier, greener, and smarter world, and our goal is to make every endpoint intelligent by offering product solutions in the automotive, industrial, infrastructure and IoT markets. Our robust product portfolio includes world-leading MCUs, SoCs, analog and power products, plus Winning Combination solutions that curate these complementary products. We are a key supplier to the world‚Äôs leading manufacturers of electronics you rely on every day; you may not see our products, but they are all around you.

Renesas employs roughly 21,000 people in more than 30 countries worldwide. As a global team, our employees actively embody the Renesas Culture, our guiding principles based on five key elements: Transparent, Agile, Global, Innovative, and Entrepreneurial. Renesas believes in, and has a commitment to, diversity and inclusion, with initiatives and a leadership team dedicated to its resources and values. At Renesas, we want to build a sustainable future where technology helps make our lives easier. Join us and build your future by being part of what‚Äôs next in electronics and the world.

Job Description

The Software Developer is responsible for developing and testing Software Frameworks used internally and externally to support bring-up, configuration and testing of Renesas products.

They must provide support to internal customers to resolve SW issues, system integration and evaluation requirements. The engineer needs to be able to gather SW requirements and define SW specifications. They must document the design and implementation of SW tools developed and must build and deliver SW collateral to project schedules and deadlines. The engineer will maintain and extend existing Frameworks as well as develop entirely new features and tools as required.

As such, the engineer will be skilled in test driven development, delivering scalable solutions and adhering to coding standards. They will be familiar with version control, continuous integration, task estimation/planning and code reviews. The engineer will be part of a cross-site Software Frameworks Team reporting to a remote lead. Teamwork, communication, innovation, and technical skills are essential for success in the role.

Qualifications


Bachelor level with working experience in Software engineering.
Competent in software engineering, with focus on coding and testing.
Python programming knowledge.
Ability to perform SW system integration onto hardware reference platforms.
Ability to prioritise work, set goals and meet deadlines.
Good written and verbal communication skills.
Motivation to learn and apply new skills.
Customer (internal/external) interface ability, including cultural awareness.
Typescript and React experience/knowledge (beneficial)


Additional Information


Concise and precise communication, internal and with customer.
Ability to work with engineers from other disciplines (circuit design, customer applications, software, QA).
Cross cultural awareness and sensitivity within multisite and multicultural environments.
Flexible to undertake occasional international travel.
Excellent command of verbal and written English.


Additional Information

Renesas Electronics Corporation empowers a safer, smarter and more sustainable future where technology helps make our lives easier. The leading global provider of microcontrollers, Renesas combines our expertise in embedded processing, analog, power and connectivity to deliver complete semiconductor solutions. These Winning Combinations accelerate time to market for automotive, industrial, infrastructure and IoT applications, enabling billions of connected, intelligent devices that enhance the way people work and live. Learn more at www.renesas.com.

Renesas‚Äô mission, To Make Our Lives Easier, is underpinned by our company culture, TAGIE. TAGIE stands for Transparent, Agile, Global, Innovative and Entrepreneurial. Our goal is to embed this unique culture in everything we do to succeed as a company and create trust with our diverse colleagues, customers and stakeholders.

Renesas Electronics is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, committed to supporting diversity and fostering a work environment free of discrimination on the basis of sex, race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military status, veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. For more information, please read our Diversity & Inclusion Statement.
